result.execSummary:
The defendant Rodney William Dionne was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "F" Felony], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per Judge Edward F. Vlack - Parties agree to 125 days credit as of October 21, 2016 against ultimate sentence.

Defendant is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of Probation.
Court reads-in and dismisses Count 2 and 3.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
Apply bond on file.
DNA surcharge.

-Programming as recommended by Agent.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Take all prescribed medications.
-Maintain full-time employment.
-Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-NO CONTACT whatsoever with Jordan Schirmer, Brandon Killion, Sallie Scheeringa, Thomas Dylan or Tyler Haugland (including names provided by parents to Agent.).
-NO CONTACT whatsoever with Main Street Pizza.
-Restorative Justice Program.
-Random UA's and PBT's.
-Defendant to submit a DNA sample.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

timeConds.notes:
Sentence to commence October 21, 2016.
Huber granted for work release and AODA treatment.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Gross, Clerk: Rohan, ADA:   Megan E. Kelly   DF ATTY:  Alex Stormont   DF:  Rodney William Dionne appeared from jail. Cases called at 2:24 pm. Includes 15CF341, 16CF158, 16CF295.  K. Kitzberger is present in Court. Court received PSI. Atty. Stormont is prepared to proceed. ADA Kelly reviews factual errors PSI and Court makes modifications to PSI on page 4. Atty. Stormont stipulates to changes. ADA Kelly gives sentencing recommendation and requests 30 days to submit restitution request. Atty. Stormont responds. Rodney Dionne addresses Court. Court Orders:
In 15CF341 Count 1: Sent W/H, 3 years probation with conditions:
-11 months conditional jail time with Huber for work release or AODA treatment
-Follow through with AODA recommended treatment 
-Programming recommended by agent
-No entry in bar or tavern or place where primary business is sale of alcohol
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Take medications as prescribed by physician
-No possession of a firearm
-Maintain full-time employment
-Cannot operate motor vehicle without valid license
-No contact with known drug users including: Jordan Schermer, Brandon Killian, Sallie Scheeringa, Thomas, Dylan, and Tyler Haugland and additional names provided by parents to Agent. No contact with Main Street Pizza. 
-Programming by Restorative Justice
-Random UA's and PBT's
-Submit to DNA and pay surcharge $200
-Court costs $253
-Restitution to be determined
-Court finds DEF is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program/Substance Abuse Program 

16CF295 Count 1
Sent W/H, 3 years probation, concurrent to 15CF341

16CF158 Count 4: 30 days St. Croix County Jail, concurrent to condition time in 15CF341 and 16CF295
Court grants eligibility for expungement upon successful completion. 
Court reserves on Drug Court

 Review hearing scheduled for November 21, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

16CF158, 16CF193, 15CF341, 15CF465 and 15CF563

- Defendant must reside with parents at 1126 Park St. Star Prairie, WI 54026

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Mainstreet Pizza, Tyler Haugland and Thomas Haugland.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- Report every other Monday commencing May 9th, 2016 and every other Wednesday commencing May 18th 2016,  before 10:00 am  to St Croix County Jail for UA testing, in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex and provide a valid/verified UA sample.  If UA tests positive or if a valid/verified sample is not provided, defendant shall submit to additional evidentiary testing to determine the use of substances forbidden by this bond agreement at the jail or Hudson Hospital.  Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each test.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Mainstreet Pizza.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: EFV, RPT: Elizabeth Frank, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:  Sharon Correll,  DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea,  DF:  Rodney William Dionne appeared.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. Defendant does qualify for PD. Waive speedy prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 11:15 am.
